verses.kjv: Now Peter and John went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer, being the ninth hour.
verses.web: Peter and John were going up into the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour.
verses.ct: One afternoon, Peter and John headed to the temple for the regular 3 o'clock prayer time.

verses.kjv: And a certain man lame from his mother’s womb was carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask alms of them that entered into the temple;
verses.web: A certain man who was lame from his mother’s womb was being carried, whom they laid daily at the door of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask gifts for the needy of those who entered into the temple.
verses.ct: Near the entrance was a man who had been unable to walk since birth. Every day, people carried him to the temple gate known as the Beautiful Gate so he could beg for money from those going in.

verses.kjv: Who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple asked an alms.
verses.web: Seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, he asked to receive gifts for the needy.
verses.ct: When he saw Peter and John about to enter the temple, he asked them for money.

verses.kjv: And Peter, fastening his eyes upon him with John, said, Look on us.
verses.web: Peter, fastening his eyes on him, with John, said, “Look at us.”
verses.ct: Peter looked straight at him, and so did John. "Look at us," Peter said.

verses.kjv: And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something of them.
verses.web: He listened to them, expecting to receive something from them.
verses.ct: The man gave them his full attention, expecting them to give him something.

verses.kjv: Then Peter said, Silver and gold have I none; but such as I have give I thee: In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth rise up and walk.
verses.web: But Peter said, “I have no silver or gold, but what I have, that I give you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, get up and walk!”
verses.ct: Peter said, "I don't have any silver or gold, but I'll give you what I do have. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, get up and walk!"

verses.kjv: And he took him by the right hand, and lifted him up: and immediately his feet and ankle bones received strength.
verses.web: He took him by the right hand and raised him up. Immediately his feet and his ankle bones received strength.
verses.ct: Then Peter grabbed the man's right hand and pulled him to his feet. Instantly, strength surged into his feet and ankles.

verses.kjv: And he leaping up stood, and walked, and entered with them into the temple, walking, and leaping, and praising God.
verses.web: Leaping up, he stood and began to walk. He entered with them into the temple, walking, leaping, and praising God.
verses.ct: He jumped up, stood on his own, and started walking. He went into the temple with them — walking, leaping, and praising God.

verses.kjv: And all the people saw him walking and praising God:
verses.web: All the people saw him walking and praising God.
verses.ct: Everyone there saw him walking around and praising God.

verses.kjv: And they knew that it was he which sat for alms at the Beautiful gate of the temple: and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened unto him.
verses.web: They recognized him, that it was he who used to sit begging for gifts for the needy at the Beautiful Gate of the temple. They were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.
verses.ct: They recognized him as the same man who always sat begging at the Beautiful Gate, and they were completely stunned by what had happened to him.

verses.kjv: And as the lame man which was healed held Peter and John, all the people ran together unto them in the porch that is called Solomon’s, greatly wondering.
verses.web: As the lame man who was healed held on to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the porch that is called Solomon’s, greatly wondering.
verses.ct: The healed man clung to Peter and John, and a crowd came rushing toward them at Solomon's Porch, absolutely amazed.

verses.kjv: And when Peter saw it, he answered unto the people, Ye men of Israel, why marvel ye at this? or why look ye so earnestly on us, as though by our own power or holiness we had made this man to walk?
verses.web: When Peter saw it, he responded to the people, “You men of Israel, why do you marvel at this man? Why do you fasten your eyes on us, as though by our own power or godliness we had made him walk?
verses.ct: When Peter saw the crowd gathering, he spoke up: "People of Israel, why are you so shocked by this? Why are you staring at us like we made this man walk by our own power or godliness?

verses.kjv: The God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob, the God of our fathers, hath glorified his Son Jesus; whom ye delivered up, and denied him in the presence of Pilate, when he was determined to let him go.
verses.web: The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his Servant Jesus, whom you delivered up, and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he had determined to release him.
verses.ct: The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob — the God of our ancestors — has brought glory to his Son Jesus. You handed him over and rejected him right in front of Pilate, even though Pilate had decided to release him.

verses.kjv: But ye denied the Holy One and the Just, and desired a murderer to be granted unto you;
verses.web: But you denied the Holy and Righteous One and asked for a murderer to be granted to you,
verses.ct: You rejected the Holy and Righteous One and demanded that a murderer be set free instead.

verses.kjv: And killed the Prince of life, whom God hath raised from the dead; whereof we are witnesses.
verses.web: and killed the Prince of life, whom God raised from the dead, to which we are witnesses.
verses.ct: You killed the Prince of life, but God raised him from the dead — and we are witnesses to that.

verses.kjv: And his name through faith in his name hath made this man strong, whom ye see and know: yea, the faith which is by him hath given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.
verses.web: By faith in his name, his name has made this man strong, whom you see and know. Yes, the faith which is through him has given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.
verses.ct: It's through faith in Jesus' name that this man was healed — this man you can see standing right here. The faith that comes through Jesus has given him complete healing, right before your eyes.

verses.kjv: And now, brethren, I wot that through ignorance ye did it, as did also your rulers.
verses.web: “Now, brothers, I know that you did this in ignorance, as did also your rulers.
verses.ct: Now, brothers, I know that you acted out of ignorance, and so did your leaders.

verses.kjv: But those things, which God before had shewed by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he hath so fulfilled.
verses.web: But the things which God announced by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he thus fulfilled.
verses.ct: But God was fulfilling what he had announced long ago through all his prophets — that Christ would suffer.

verses.kjv: Repent ye therefore, and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out, when the times of refreshing shall come from the presence of the Lord;
verses.web: “Repent therefore, and turn again, that your sins may be blotted out, so that there may come times of refreshing from the presence of the Lord,
verses.ct: So repent and turn back to God, so that your sins may be wiped away and times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord.

verses.kjv: And he shall send Jesus Christ, which before was preached unto you:
verses.web: and that he may send Christ Jesus, who was ordained for you before,
verses.ct: Then he will send Jesus, the Christ who was appointed for you.

verses.kjv: Whom the heaven must receive until the times of restitution of all things, which God hath spoken by the mouth of all his holy prophets since the world began.
verses.web: whom heaven must receive until the times of restoration of all things, which God spoke long ago by the mouth of his holy prophets.
verses.ct: Heaven must receive him until the time comes for God to restore all things — just as he promised long ago through his holy prophets.

verses.kjv: For Moses truly said unto the fathers, A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you.
verses.web: For Moses indeed said to the fathers, ‘The Lord God will raise up a prophet for you from among your brothers, like me. You shall listen to him in all things whatever he says to you.
verses.ct: Moses himself told our ancestors, 'The Lord your God will raise up a prophet for you from among your own people, just like me. You must listen to everything he tells you.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that every soul, which will not hear that prophet, shall be destroyed from among the people.
verses.web: It will be that every soul that will not listen to that prophet will be utterly destroyed from among the people.’
verses.ct: Anyone who refuses to listen to that prophet will be completely cut off from God's people.'

verses.kjv: Yea, and all the prophets from Samuel and those that follow after, as many as have spoken, have likewise foretold of these days.
verses.web: Yes, and all the prophets from Samuel and those who followed after, as many as have spoken, they also told of these days.
verses.ct: Every prophet from Samuel onward — all who have spoken — also pointed to these very days.

verses.kjv: Ye are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying unto Abraham, And in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.
verses.web: You are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘All the families of the earth will be blessed through your offspring.’
verses.ct: You are the heirs of those prophets and of the covenant God made with your ancestors when he told Abraham, 'Through your offspring, all the families of the earth will be blessed.'

verses.kjv: Unto you first God, having raised up his Son Jesus, sent him to bless you, in turning away every one of you from his iniquities.
verses.web: God, having raised up his servant Jesus, sent him to you first to bless you, in turning away every one of you from your wickedness.”
verses.ct: God raised up his Son Jesus and sent him to you first, to bless you by turning each of you away from your wicked ways."
